modules.description: This collection of utilities focuses on file manipulation, data transformation, and numerical operations. It handles strings, lists, arrays, and files with functions for safe I/O, temporary file management, line-based processing, and structured data serialization. Common use cases include log file analysis, data validation pipelines, and numerical computations requiring statistical measures or type-safe conversions.

This module implements linear regression training and prediction workflows using standardized input data. It provides functions to read and process CSV files, compute standardization parameters, train models with optimization weights, and serialize models to disk. Key operations include matrix conversion, data normalization, model parameter combination, and prediction on new input arrays.

Draws a regression plot from two lists of floating-point values, saving the result to a specified file. Works with lists of numerical data representing x and y coordinates. Useful for visualizing linear relationships in datasets directly from OCaml code.

This module combines linear regression modeling with data visualization and file processing capabilities. It supports training predictive models from CSV data, generating regression plots from numerical lists, and handling structured data transformations. Typical workflows include statistical analysis of numerical datasets, model evaluation through visualization, and data preprocessing for machine learning pipelines.
